revised_title: Quantitative Dental Characteristics of Chimpanzees, Gorillas, and Orang-Outangs
tldr: This study measures the crowns of teeth from 79 chimpanzees, 89 gorillas, and 63 orang-outangs, providing basic statistical data for 48 dimensions and indices of deciduous teeth and 78 dimensions of permanent dentition for each type of ape. The research aims to provide a basis for quantitative comparisons between the teeth of existing and fossil anthropoids, contributing to a better understanding of the dental patterns and differences between species.
